section-block.flip_chart-concept-question: What can happen when we try something new?

flip_chart-teacher-facing-content-box.flip_chart-teacher-facing-paragraph: I love to go fast. But I can’t always go as fast as I want. My legs don’t move as well as other kids’ do. Leg braces help keep my legs strong.

I look for sports where I can race and go fast. When I heard about wheelchair racing, I knew I had to try it. I needed a few things to start wheelchair racing. First, I needed a racing wheelchair. It is different from a regular wheelchair. Next, I needed to learn how to race. My coaches trained me. They taught me how to do it.
Now, I love to race! I’m not an expert yet. I am always learning and getting better. Here’s how I get ready for a race:
Wheelchair racing is hard. I stretch before I race. Otherwise, I could get a cramp.
You can’t just push the wheels and go as fast as you can. You have to learn how to turn, slow down, and stop.
I wear a helmet. I have a cast right now, too, because I broke my arm. I didn’t break it wheelchair racing!
A speedometer is on the wheelchair. It shows me how fast I am going. I want to go as fast as I can!
